Edit: 2022
The game has changed a lot since my initial review, so some of the details here may no longer be accurate but the spirit of it remains the same! Honestly this game is fun just to watch it update and change, even if it's never officially finished because there's just so much to see and explore. There's a passionate team behind it, lots to do and it's really cute! Give it your support!


Original review 2018:
I'm sad that this game flew under my radar for so long, because it really is something special. 
At the moment it's a little empty, there's a large map but only one monthly festival and few quests. But even what's here is delightful to play. There's a wide variety of animals (though I am hoping for alpacas and pigs!) and wild animals to tame. I gather the pets will have more to do in future updates.

There are entertaining puzzles around, little secrets to hunt for - just yesterday I found a random blue crystal under a tree - which encourages you to think outside the box. 
Your character is adorable and emotive, something I had a problem with in Stardew Valley. I hope there will be clothes to collect later!

This has every indication of surpassing Stardew Valley. I'm excited! There are a few bugs but the Dev is very good about fixing them and generally they aren't that bothersome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083128319', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1533163727}
review:
Harvest Moon foi um título memorável que deu início ao amor por um gênero e quase que acabou se tornando o próprio gênero, visto que os jogos "de fazendinha" são também conhecidos como "jogos tipo Harvest Moon". Mais interessante ainda é ver os muitos jogos inspirados nesse clássico, porém, cada um com sua peculiaridade, com o toque único de seu desenvolvedor, e em [b]Fantasy Farming - Orange Season[/b] não é diferente. Apesar de ser dirigido ao nicho dos jogos simuladores de fazenda, ele desponta com suas particularidades e, por estar ainda em desenvolvimento, nos traz novidades e anseio de conteúdos cada vez melhores.

Prova disso é que comprei e joguei este jogo há pouco mais de um ano atrás. Volto agora (em julho de 2018) e vejo que o trabalho não parou. A interface deixou de ser genérica, semelhante a um placeholder, e tomou um pouco de forma, caminhando para um visual mais aconchegante e combinando com o jogo, dispondo melhor seu conteúdo e de maneira mais agradável. Ainda no visual, vários gráficos foram alterados, para uma arte singular e mais bela (ainda não foram todos, mas espero que uma repaginação total esteja nos planos). Vejo a jogabilidade como mais fluida, os comandos são respondidos mais prontamente e o desempenho do jogo está visivelmente melhor. Tudo isso é prova de um acesso antecipado bem aproveitado, mantendo o jogo atualizado, corrigindo problemas e trazendo novidades, fazendo bom uso e respeitando a confiança daqueles que adquirem o jogo com ele ainda em desenvolvimento. É algo a se incentivar.

Algo que é presente em muitos jogos do tipo e que não notei diferença aqui é a inconstância de ocupação do jogador, principalmente no começo. É comum o [i]mid-game[/i] ser agitado, afinal lá teremos plantações vastas, porém, o início moroso pode ser entediante para quem gosta de trabalho sobrando desde o começo. Seria interessante indicar ao jogador, no início, modos de ele investir o tempo livre, ainda melhor se existirem atividades que terão consequências no progresso do jogo.

Um ponto notável aqui é o comportamento do mundo ao redor do jogador. Ainda que haja os eventos que seguem o roteiro, não é como se o mundo dependesse de ti, enquanto jogador, para funcionar. À excessão dos personagens que lhe darão dicas, o mundo parece caminhar bem independente da sua presença. A qualquer momento tu pode seguir um outro personagem e ele estará fazendo seu trajeto naturalmente. Da mesma forma são os eventos. Alguns jogos são construídos para que tu vá tendo um desempenho melhor a cada evento até finalmente vencer um. Aqui, porém, sinto como se a vitória em um evento estivesse ao meu alcance desde o começo, e acho isso mais justo, principalmente se não é a primeira vez que está jogando o jogo e já possui as "manhas" de como iniciar bem.

De volta aos gráficos, é uma pixel arte muito bonita, agradável. Porém, a previamente citada atualização trouxe eles ao passo que manteve alguns gráficos antigos, que na minha opinião destoam um pouco, ainda mais os antigos não sendo tão belos. Espero que futuramente todo visual venha a ser renovado. Os cenários são um tanto vazios. Apesar de uma área de exploração grande, os mapas não convidam a exploração, por serem vazios e os barrancos e chão de terra não serem muito agradáveis. Mais diversidade de lugares e um [i]level design[/i] de lugares mais únicos incentivaria bastante a exploração, e talvez até resolvesse o que mencionei de o jogador não ter o que fazer no começo, incentivando-o a conhecer a vizinhança.

Parabenizo o desenvolvedor por manter-se firme no desenvolvimento, atento ao público, à comunidade e honrar àqueles que apoiaram o acesso antecipado. Acho que em um jogo que o conteúdo busca prender o jogador por horas assim, manter-se ativo e com dinâmica de novidades ajuda a manter o jogo vivo, uma prática que muitos não aderem e acaba levando jogos com ideias interessantíssimas ao esquecimento. Torço para que tudo siga bem na criação e, apesar de não ser um jogador ávido desse gênero, jogar apenas casualmente,  um dia poder sentar e me deliciar com este game concluído com todo potencial que ele promete ter.

review:
I am a fan of RPG-Farming-Life-Sims. 
   I am a fan of the Harvest Moon series (before the latest ... but even then there's something vaguely redeeming), and happily played days away on Stardew Valley. 
   Finding a farming sim is easy, these days. The Internet seems to be crawling with them. 
   So, when I say that Fantasy Farming:Orange Season is different, even though it seems to follow the same formula, Trust me, it's different.
   Yes, it's still in development. The person behind the game is very active in his community of players and is actively working to make the game as good as possible, given what he envisioned. 
  There is no combat at this time. There are two towns of people to explore. Multiple mines to do mining for ores and gems; an interesting randomized request board; fishing; Rune Factory-style "seasonal" fields hidden away in caverns and caves, mountains to explore and forage through, and a secret hidden society.
   For non-violent fantasy, with responsibility, budgeting, and even some interesting animal breeding available, what's not to love? You can upgrade your house and your tools, buy seeds, buy and care for animals, raise "better" animals depending on what you personally consider better, and spend days wanderng the mountains or fighing in the ocean. 
  My advice? Get in on the ground floor and help shape the game. But, if that's not for you ... it's still a good playable game with regular updates and an active community.

review:
**EDITED: SEE BELOW FOR ORIGINAL REVIEW, 1 YEAR AGO**

I have never gone back to edit a review but I'm very glad I tried playing this game again after letting it sit in my library for a year. Due to boredom waiting for the new SDV update, I decided to give it another shot--and WOW, what an improvement!! This game is now set up to become one of my favorite farming RPGs as long as the devs keep working on it. The graphics that were once painfully awkward are now cute and charming. The controls have improved immensely. And the level of detail is what makes this game stand apart most of all.

Unlike a lot of farming RPGs, this one is layered with nuance. Characters are dynamic and entertaining as you'd get in SDV, with self-aware/fourth-wall-breaking dialogue, and there are more options than in most other games. Chickens, cows, goats, and horses all come with multiple colors you can choose from when purchasing; there are dogs and cats (with a wide range of colorings, compared to other titles), as well as interactable turtles and squirrels, and even some beavers. Each season has a large number of different wild flowers/fruits to collect, and lots of them, and the world is relatively large with a lot of areas to explore, including maze-like elements in the mines and an "enchanted" forrest. 

I can't wait for more features to be added--especially dating/marriage, as there are lots of single villagers already implemented. The devs also say there will be even more animals in future versions, which I look forward to as well! 

Happy to say I can now vehemently recommend this game! Devs, keep up the good work!!!

*************************************************************************************************

This needs a lot more updates and polishing before it will be playable for me... great premise, very promising, but right now I just can't stand the mechanics and the graphics, unfortunately.

review:
I bought this game on a whim, wanting a farming game to save me from summer ennui and before Stardew Valley can update. I'm happy to say that it didn't disappoint. I played the demo for nearly two hours! Anyway, some notes of what I like:
 - Fast Player Character movement
 - Ability to teleport early game
 - Minimalist animation for actions (picking crops, etc)
 - Random animals to pet!!
 - I was leery about the stamina/fatigue mechanic (reminiscent of Harvest Moon A New Beginning) but managing it is much simpler due to food availability, particularly for early game.
 - Interesting that there's no combat (so far), but magic is present in-game
 - Unified storage!!
 - Ability to move buildings (coop, etc) all over the farm by yourself
 - Potential to buy more lands
 - And to have a bank account?

What can be improved:
 - too many screens. While I see that it compensates for how quickly the PC moves, it disrupts the game too much and makes it difficult to envision a cohesive world
 - for mouse users: too much clicking when harvesting crops. It would be nice if PC can just hold left click (a la Stardew Valley)
 - some graphic/action issues in planting. Sometimes clicking the tilled dirt isn't enough; PC has to be at a certain distance/angle for seed to be planted. planting is easier in keyboard mode though.
 - better character sprites? or maybe character portraits

All in all, it's a fun game. It has potential and I can't wait to play further as more content comes out.

review:
I've played about almost all the way through the first month. Time of Writing is around patch .3 . The game has so much love from the creator, Hudell. The game feels pretty familiar to HM:FoM in terms of focus. Got a farm, got some seeds, will plant and damn if anyone plans to get in the way. Starting out you go through the struggle of managing stamina while you try not to pass out while planting some potatos. It's the usual, which is pleasant. 

The music is pleasant and never feels really out of place. I still need to listen to the rest of the seasons. The spring has this upbeat flute and piano piece which I've caught myself humming along with without really realizing it. AT night the music becomes calm, reminescent of a quiet night in the country. I noticed there's not a lot of sound during rain. . Hudell has noted there plans to be more variation of music throughout the day so maybe around then there'll be more ambient noises during rainy days.

 There's nice variety currently with the animals. For each animal you have a selection of colors for each of them so you cankeep control of your perfect all white chicken coop or if you want to have a menagerie of different colored fowls. Did i mention you can also have a yak? In true fashion you can also have a pet dog (maybe a cat in the future? who knoooows) whom I didn't know could turn into the most adorable set of pixels when I picked it up.

Last thing, that I think is the most important part of the game is its art. Houses look generally Housey. The thing that struck me the most about the art is that it really looks like a contryish type of village. Dirt in places, trees all over, the occasional annoying rock that I'm totally gonna smash if my stamina wasn't too low. There isn't portraits for the characters at the moment, however Hudell has shared some artwork on his discord and they look absolutely gorgeous with a very unique look to them.

This definitely is a game worth at the very least keepign an eye on. Hudell has so many ideas and plans for the game that I think will allow for a unique experience. Plus you can  have a guy legitmately tell you to stomp your crops if they sass you, same guy also asked me for milk to fix his furniture. Many of the characters stand out so well just from their personality, be it questionable farming advice to me questioning why does my doctor want to me get hurt.

review:
I thought this would be a fun game right up there with stardew valley.  Unfortunately it was too much like Stardew Valley quite literally an near exact copy of Stardew Valley nothing new nor interesting or even unique.  I wish I could have asked for a refund for this game as it's very boring if you've played Stardew Valley and has nothing new to contribute in it's former state and I think the developer has abandoned it.  Based on the developer's comment below I will give this game another chance, I didn't see any update in the news section as the last one was shown to be in May.  

Tried to play some more it's relaxing playing this game, but as I mentioned in my prior paragraph it's still lacking substance...There is really no story behind your character, there is no stories behind the npcs you meet, I was sorely disappointed to read tutorials coming from the npcs which destroyed the immersion of the game for me, there are no backgrounds either to the npcs you meet, unlike Stardew Valley and even World's Dawn these npcs will speak to you about what you need in the game but that's about it so far, tney have no fears, likes, or lifestories to them, the writing is just not there.  I found that having no map either was really frustrating as you would wander about no idea where you're no idea where you need to go either.  If you can polish this off add some stories, drama or interesting text to the npcs including your own protagonist and even a basic map would help.  Also write some background stories about each npc you meet in the friends and add some likes and dislikes for gifts, add interesting text to what each npc has to say get rid of the tutorials coming from their mouths, if you want a tutorial add one in the beginning for players to use but you're killing the immersion of the game letting your npcs tell me "I need an axe to cut down trees" over and over again or don't work too hard you will lose stamina.  In the real world people don't say those things.  Try adding some realism, adding some drama, making your npcs interesting and intriguing, add a basic map and than I will change my review to a more positive one.

review:
More people need to know about this game! 

Hudell... Advertise it a ton because it's awesome and you deserve a lot of backing to develop this even further! This is Early Access done right!

Good points in brief:

- Farming, foraging, mining, festivals, animals, good music - What's not to love?!
- Multiple towns
- Ability to tame wild animals
- Tons of animal species, plus multiple colour options for each animal
- THE MUSIC
- Serious potential, and in a great playable state already even though it's still EA.
- Nice looking characters
- Responsive dev with regular updates.

Loving it so much right now... (I played a good ten hours on the demo too so the hours are decieving). 

Improvements needed/ hopeful additions: 

Literally cannot wait for the addition of cooking, dating/marriage, more festivals and hopefully leisure options (a bar or social spot of some sort? Maybe even some extra little mini games, or raise the difficulty of fishing to make it more of a challenge?) 

It's hard to give downsides because my only 'bad points' are things which I think Hudell has plans to include in the future.. The above for example.. plus would be nice to see more conversation options with the characters so you can feel a bit more invested in them, so far I don't have any opinions good or bad on any character because you can't really see their 'personalities' as it stands. Will be nice to see that expanded on as there's real potential there, the character models are great and I'm already starting to envisage my own personas for them! :')

Also the bathroom becoming functional would be great... use of one bath a day replenishes you stamina perhaps? As if you have 30+ crops planted in the early game stages, you're left with 2 hearts after watering them and it's only 8am!

The 'foraging area' is awesome but still feels a little baron, perhaps add an extra house or two out there with more reclusive or obscure characters? Or some leisure activity place of some sort?

All in all I'm loving the game so far and I really do expect that the above will all be expanded on in the future, the dev seems really on-the-ball and responsive, and is really vocal on disscussion boards and on Discord. Everyone will compare it to Stardew Valley, but it definitely has the ability to stand firmly on its own. If you're debating on getting it in early access... go for it. It's completely playable in this state and the more support the Dev recieves.. the quicker I'm sure we'll see content expansion and progress. 

Keep up the good work, I'm really pysched for future updates!!

review:
I discovered this game while searching for something similar to Stardew Valley that could be played on a mac (on which it runs fantastically), and I am so excited about this game.  Yes, it is early access, but it does have a terrific amount of content in place, the developer is exceedingly active both in adding new content and in listening to player requests, and the potential for what this game could become is wonderful.  The game is moddable, but, since it is in early access, there are only a few, developer mods available right now.  However, once released, the game will have a workshop and allow players to mod and customize to their heart's content.

As for the gameplay, it is very similar to games like Harvest Moon and Stardew Valley.  You get a farm, farm, build relationships with local residents, fulfill tasks, etc.  Each season is a full month and contains a festival.  Right now, you can play through the seasons, farming, foraging, and fishing.  You can also start accumulating livestock, raising everything from chickens to yaks.  While you can "breed" chickens, I don't believe this feature has been implemented yet for the other livestock.  Your chickens and ducks will lay eggs, but I haven't figured out how to milk the goats, cows, etc. (this might not be implemented quite yet).  You also can build friendships with both locals and animals as well as tame wild animals to bring to your farm.  

While many features are still in progress, you can easily see where they are going.  For example, romantic relationships are hinted at right now in the game and probably coming soon.  The potential to breed livestock is also in place, and there are myriad areas that you can enter in the game that are also still in development such as the graveyard and forest maze.  The developer, as I mentioned before, is extremely active, which is delightful as it appears there is about 1 huge update per month that adds excellent new features and expands on ones currently in place.  In fact, the game's website nicely lists at least 5 huge updates and the content that each will potentially contain.

Even with the more limited content, I currently have over 20 hours invested in the game and am only now entering the Summer season.  If you enjoy these sorts of games, I would highly recommend getting a copy of Fantasy Farming and watching the game unfold.

The only thing I really have a problem with so far is the graphics sometimes make it difficult to tell what level plain you're on. It's not that I don't like the graphics in and of themselves, but at times the top of a mountain can look on the same level as the ground. More than once I have found myself walking toward a river or a bunch of rocks only to run into the side of mountain I didn't realize wasw there. This could very well be me not being used to the game style, but if there was a way to make it a little more obvious were the walls are I think that would be very helpful. 

Other than that minor detal, I am really enjoying this game. I especially love how the character can actual speak now, that you can teleport home (which is incredibly useful considering the size of the map), and that there is a rivalry marriage system. I have a lot left to explore in the game itself, but I have a feeling I am going to enjoy this game very much.

review:
Hey, I received a free copy of this game and I streamed it last night(11/21/2017), if you want a video review, I stated a review at the end of 2 hours of streaming which can be found here( https://www.twitch.tv/videos/203440203 )

I really did enjoy this game overall, however I would not spend $13.99 on it at this moment. This game is well made graphically and most interactions happen without a hitch! The graphics are nice and the overall feel of the game is good.

However, a few points that I was not a fan of is the music in the game, there are only like 3/4 tracks that play on a loop and they feel more of music in the game, as opposed to background music. What I mean is that you're more aware of the music being there and always being there and being on a loop, that it gets annoying at times. 

Okay, "music not that big of a deal, I play it on mute and have my own music playing in the background" exactly, it's not a huge deal at all, just a slight annoyance at times.

This game is also very [b]not[/b] hand-holdy at all. Which is both good and bad.
It's good because it lets you get right into the game without annoying tutorials taking up your entire first week/month of the game, so that's really nice.
On the other hand, because of that the game is very much just "Okay....GO!" and you just start wandering around until things happen.

Which, I do get part of this game [b]is[/b] exploration, and the exploration, map size, things to see are really nice, vast, large, etc. I loved the exploration in this game and how large the maps were and the things to do and see in each of them! It really made the world a lot more interesting than that of like Stardew Valley.

[spoiler]You don't get handed all your tools, you have to go out and find them, which I love. It was awesome just roaming around then finding a box and suddenly getting a new tool! It was much better than having all the tools just handed to you, or having to complete X things to get a cutscene.[/spoiler]

Overall, I would recommend this game, but not yet. There is so much that can be done with this game that I am excited to see where it goes from here, as it is still in Early Access. I will certainly be following this game and wanting to see what happens in it, because it was good, but not quite there yet(I feel anyway)
Maybe one day I will feel it's worth that price tag, but at this moment I would feel more comfortable spending $7.99-9.99 on this game. But that's just my opinion and I certainly wouldn't tell anyone to [b]not[/b] get this game and support the dev team, as they did a great job and I'm excited to see what they do with it!

review:
[h1]🎮 [u]Fantasy Farming: Orange Season[/u] 🎮[/h1]

Wie unschwer anhand der Screenshots zu erkennen ist, ist [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/416000/Fantasy_Farming_Orange_Season/]Fantasy Farming: Orange Season[/url] ein Farming-Simulator, welcher sich inhaltlich und grafisch stark an [url=https://www.amazon.de/gp/search/ref=as_li_qf_sp_sr_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=xeeran-21&keywords=harvest moon&index=aps&camp=1638&creative=6742&linkCode=xm2&linkId=257c9da503f0242f7f730cc051316e37]Harvest Moon[/url] orientiert und natürlich auch Parallelen zu [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/413150/Stardew_Valley/]Stardew Valley[/url] aufweist. Dabei lässt sich der Charakter des Spiels schon ganz gut erkennen, wenngleich sich das Spiel noch mit Version 0.2.6 in der Early-Access-Phase befindet. Der Sound, bestehend aus Flöten- & Keyboardmusik plus gelegentlichem Glockenspiel, passt dabei zum idyllischen Dasein als Farmer. Die Steuerung, sowohl mit Maus & Tastatur als auch mit dem Controller (XBox Wireless 360), ist einfach und gut.

[b]Das Gameplay[/b]

In einem Tutorial wird man an die Mechaniken des Spiels, simpel und einfach erklärt, herangeführt ehe man eigenständig agieren darf. In den ersten Tagen gilt es dann vor allen Dingen das Spiel zu begreifen und die Werkzeuge des Farmer sein zu finden. Des Weiteren ergeben sich auch schon die ersten Quests, die man als Starthilfe erachten darf. Wesentliche Bestandteile sind hier natürlich der Anbau von Pflanzen, wobei man zu Beginn recht limitiert ist. Es fehlt halt noch das nötige Kleingeld! Das kann man allerdings durch das Schürfen von Erzen in der Mine ganz gut und recht schnell erhalten, wenn man sie dann raffiniert und verkauft. 

Zuvor hat man jedoch auch das ein oder andere Rätsel zu lösen, wobei der Schwierigkeitsgrad äußerst moderat gehalten ist. Hier hat man eindeutig die Casual-Szene im Blick. Auch das Suchen, Finden und Sammeln von Gegenständen (Blumen, Obst, etc.) ist ein essentieller Bestandteil der einem das Leben erleichtert. Mit fortschreitender Zeit kann man dann auch andere Pflanzen anbauen, die Werkzeuge und die Farm upgraden und sich auch mal ein Tier zulegen, welches dann gehegt, gepflegt und aufgezogen werden muss. Alles in allem steht einem dann ein rundum erfüllendes Farmerleben ins Haus und wer auch mal entspannen möchte, der geht halt fischen.

[b]Features und Mankos[/b]

Für mich besonders wirken die Beziehungen zu anderen Dorfbewohnern. Diese können durch kleinere Aufgaben, z .B. das Bringen einer Blume, oder durch größere Quests, z.B. die Mitgliedschaft in der Bergbau-Liga, verbessert werden. Dabei haben die Charaktere alle eine eigene Persönlichkeit, sofern man sich mit ihnen beschäftigt. Leider sind die Dialoge noch recht beschränkt, es bleibt jedoch zu hoffen, dass sich das noch ändert und die Kommunikationsmöglichkeiten ausgeweitet werden. Als cool und lustig empfinde ich außerdem die Möglichkeit zum Schreiben von Briefen. Das geht bei allen Charakteren, inklusive der eigenen Mutter. 

Leider fehlt mir eine Karte zur einfachen Übersicht. Auch die Öffnungszeiten und Erreichbarkeit der Geschäfte ist mir zu konfus. Die Einen öffnen um 8:00 Uhr und schließen um 15:00 Uhr, die Anderen öffnen um 9:30 Uhr, schließen dafür um 17:00 Uhr und wieder Andere sind von 10:00 - 14:00 Uhr erreichbar. Da stellt sich einem schon die Frage: Warum? 

[b]Fazit[/b]

Für einen Early-Access-Titel wirkt das Spiel schon recht weit. Die implementierten Features und Planungen dbzgl. scheinen durchdacht zu sein und ergänzen das Farmerleben auf passende Art und Weise. Die Entwickler von [url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?developer=Hudell%20Tales&snr=1_5_9__400]Hudell Tales[/url] bringen gefühlt alle zwei bis drei Wochen ein Update und auch die Kommunikation im Forum ist meiner Erfahrung und Beobachtung nach hervorragend. Das kenne ich auch anders! Über den Preis lässt sich wie so oft streiten. Für das gleiche Geld kann man einen der oben erwähnten Titel erhalten und hat dabei ein bereits fertig entwickeltes Spiel. Jedoch kann man hier noch Einfluss auf die Entwicklung nehmen und meines Erachtens nach bei einem Titel, welcher viel Potential in sich birgt. Daher auch die Kaufempfehlung, denn auch dafür ist Early Access gedacht.

review:
This is the first game I have purchased while still in the Early Access stage. Normally, I steer clear of these as I have heard so many horror stories about games never being finished and the developers basically running away with the money paid to them. However, the previous reviews had mentioned constant updates from the developer, and... WOW! They were not kidding! This simple farming sim game in the vein of Harvest Moon and others like it appears to be as much of a passion project for Hudell Tales as Stardew Valley was for Concerned Ape.

Please do not let my low play time for this game (half an hour, at the time of writing this) deter you from taking my words to heart when deciding whether or not Orange Season is a game you would like to spend your money on. I have played every Harvest Moon title since Friends of Mineral town, even so far as to continuing with both the Harvest Moon series and Story of Seasons games following the split between Marvelous and Nastume. Stardew Valley is my most-played game on Steam, and I even have it for the PS4 because I adore it so much. So, believe me when I tell you I have plenty of experience with these sort of games and can tell when I see a good one - even if it is still being developed.

I'm not going to lie. There are a few issues I ran into with the game, but these were mostly just small bugs and they've already been ironed out as far as I can tell. Bugs such as these are going to be present in a game which is still in Early Access, and it bugs me (pun not intended) that people always seem to focus on them when reviewing a game which has not been "officially" released. Any such issues I have had have been MINOR, and have not affected the gameplay as a whole to the point where I had to scrap my save and start over.

One of the biggest problems I have with the game - which is more of a nitpick than an actual problem - is the lack of choice in the character creator. While I appreciate that the developer has recently added in the ability to play your character as transgender (yay inclusion!), you still must play as the generic male or female model type with only the ability to change hair and skin color. Yes, I know the Harvest Moon/Story of Seasons games are pretty much the same, but Stardew Valley gave us a wide variety of things like hairstyles and clothing items to choose from in order to make every character unique to their player. I am hoping more options will be added into a later update. Yes, I know mods are a thing for the game... but I have not installed any of them and probably won't until after the game's final release in order to preserve things as the developer intended them during the ongoing development cycle.

It's saying a lot when the only true complaint you have is a lack of variety in your own character model, I think. That's why I can confidently say that anyone who is a lover of farming sims and/or a fan of Stardew Valley and looking for a little more of that sort of game to scratch their itch should seriously consider picking up Orange Season. Even with the game still being in Early Access, you will not be disapppointed! On the contrary, with the constant updates and additions from Hudell Tales, you will only have more to look forward to as time passes with this game in your library.

review:
总体评价：是一款与牧场物语类似的游戏，比较接近矿石镇等早期版本，赚钱比较辛苦，游戏内容会逐步丰富，值得尝试。
9月4日更新：
——增加新角色皮肤
——增加新农场区域，为专用畜牧区域，在市政厅Julia处购买
——增加房子扩建，在npc Rapheal处购买建造，暂无特殊效果
——增加金矿、红宝石、蓝水晶等矿石，金矿和红宝石用于农场工具的高级升级
——增加矿工协会和npc Roberto，矿工协会及相应矿区位于Rock town（山顶野外），可采集金矿
——增加矿锄、农锄、镰刀、斧子的黄金等级升级，增加洒水壶的红宝石升级
——增加银行和债务系统，可存储金钱，同时增加主角欠债背景，需要努力工作还款
——改变银矿去银矿更新规则，银矿更容易采集
——更改部分产品价格，改善游戏平衡
——给主角房子增加了一个浴室
制作人员在讨论组回复：在9月份的更新计划中，每个周日都会有小更新。值得期待。
————以下为早期版本评测
早期版本内容不多，主角离开父母来到一个叫orange town的地方，开始自己的农场生活，可以与小镇的人们交友，通过探索地图找到不同区域宝箱中的各种工具，各种工具的地址已有社区指南说明，有疑问的玩家可以查看指南。主角有体力限制，以5颗心显示，种植150左右块农田，每日浇水就会耗光体力，所以不能无脑种植赚钱，比较辛苦。
游戏内容有耕种，畜牧，采集，挖矿，升级工具，交友互动。
耕种：在小镇商店可以购买一年四季及常年耕种的种子，购买页面显示种子购买价格、种植时长、单次收获或多次收获及间期时长，以及售卖价格。
畜牧：主角家初始即有1间家禽屋，可养14只鸡，日产1-2鸡蛋/鸡，随故事进展，可在npc Lucas处获得1只公鸡，可以使家产鸡蛋受精，不捡鸡蛋让它继续孵化若干时日后孵出小鸡；1间家畜屋，可养16只牛和羊，日产1牛奶/牛，1羊奶/羊。
采集：游戏区域分为主角农场，orange小镇，海边，矿区，山林野外，湖边野外，火车站。小镇可以采集橙子，海边夏天可采集椰子和贝壳，山林野外可采集橙子、樱桃、花生、蜂巢、香蕉（夏天）以及各季花朵，湖边野外可采集橙子、樱桃、花生、香蕉（夏天）以及各季花朵。
挖矿：获取挖矿工具后，到矿区解决谜题，找到矿区分层，修复矿车，然后就可以开始挖矿了（矿区谜题可搜索社区讨论组内容"puzzle"）。3层及以上每日更新铁矿、铜矿、岩石、砂砾，6层每日更新银矿以上各种矿石，银矿设定为更新于6层右侧区域，需挖除右侧区域普通矿石，给银矿留出更新区域。银矿用于目前版本工具的最高升级。
升级工具：目前版本工具升级，采集相应矿石，在铁匠npc处制作铜块、银块，然后升级为铜质工具，再升级为银质工具。
交友互动：和其他类似游戏一样，可以通过打招呼、送礼、完成对应npc的task增进友谊，特别的一点是，还可以通过写信增进友谊，写信有普通信封和粉色信封，普通信封给普通关系的人，粉色信封写给特殊关系的人（你懂的）。制作人员回复，目前版本未更新交友互动进度，各npc爱心程度不会增加，在后续更新中可通过各种互动增进友谊度。
所有物品通过主角房屋外的出货箱出货。
游戏也有节日设定，比如赛鸡日等，可以带家养鸡去比赛，增加npc好感，获取奖品。
目前我玩到夏天中旬，还有秋冬季节没有体验。
————以下为更早期测评
还是测试阶段的作品，看到是农场经营养成类型的游戏，又在打折，毫不犹豫就买了。进去玩了几分钟，实在不敢相信，优化差得难以置信，就这106Mb的游戏，无画面单纯文字对话内容也能2秒卡个十几秒，你敢信？发现只要有对话就一定会卡，没有对话的时候就不会卡。
......
然后去了讨论提问题，开发人员很迅速解答了，并提出了有效的解决方法
option-text display-use old font设置为打开on

author: {'steamid': '76561197960526453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1537153954}
review:
I stumbled onto Fantasy Farming: Orange Seaon while looking for a game that would interest my 13 year old daughter. She loves the Harvest Moon series but honestly most of the recent titles are virtually the same, using a tired forumla and backstory with little innovation or change based on player feedback. Orange Season attempts to bring a fresh look at the farming/relationship/exploring gameplay without reinventing the wheel. At this, being early access, it has hit the nail on the head. My daughter, who is as finicky as they come, loves it. Now my son loves it and so do I. Updates are frequent and meaningful, making me feel good about my investment. Thus far, the developer seems very in tune with his growing fanbase and by all accounts, I believe this game will grow into something special and fun. I can't state it enough; Please remember that you are purchasing an early access game and thus will not experience all the planned features right away. As it stands right now, I believe the cost is worth it but if you prefer a completed game or feel you will be disatisfied by discovering content in game that is not yet in use then you may consider waiting a little longer until key elements are introduced. Overall, I love it and had to scratch my head for a few minutes to pull a few cons out. Even then, they are basically centered around the fact that it is early access. 

Pros
- Great retro graphics.
- Satisfying gameplay.
- Helpful new ideas and features that you always wished for in Harvest Moon.
- Tasks are varied and interesting with a touch of humor that my kids appreciate.
- Nice variety of activities to engage in, not just watering 50 stalks of corn every day.  
- Great for relaxing, no pressure, gameplay to either kill a few minutes or a couple hours.
- Looking for a use for your underpowered laptop? This will run on it.

Cons
- Early access. Understand you are not buying a complete game.
- Key features of this genre such as relationships, marriage, family not been fully implimented. 
- Limited use of mouse. Controls center around keyboard/controller use and can be mildly inconvenient for avid pc gamers. 

I will update again when more major updates are completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048939262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1560190419}
review:
Habe es nun angespielt und gebe mal meine Meinung ab:

Ist es ähnlich wie Stardew Valley - na sicher, deswegen habe ich es ja gekauft. 

Da beide sich an Harvest Moon orientieren, sind sie in gewissen Dingen ähnlich, aber dann auch wieder nicht. Dieses hier ist der Harvest Moon Reihe sehr viel näher als SV es ist. Es gibt mehr zu erkunden, es gibt auch noch andere Dörfer, eine Menge Höhlen, mit Rätsel darin zu lösen...wirklich süß und durchdacht gemacht. Man kann fischen, Pflanzen anbauen und ernten, Tiere erwerben, Erze abbauen, vieles in der Natur sammeln....

Es gibt seit Heute auch eine Wahl zwischen Weiblich und Männlichem Charakter. Sehr vieles muss noch richtig implementiert werden, mehr Optionen mit den Dorfbewohnern zu sprechen, es sollen noch Beziehungen kommen und Workshopanbindung, worauf ich mich freue. Liebe Mods...

Alles in allem gefällt mir hier der Art Stil sehr viel mehr als in SV, die Figuren uns Sachen sind etwas größer und schöner gearbeitet, meiner Meinung nach. Es ist für jeden der das Genre mag, einen Versuch wert. Mir macht es bisher schon Spaß und ich freue mich auf mehr.

review:
[code][h1]Полноценный обзор со скриншотами вы можете прочитать здесь: [url=https://doggamingsite.wordpress.com/2017/05/07/fantasy-farming-orange-season/] Dreams of Genesis Gaming: Fantasy Farming: Orange Season[/url][/h1][/code]

Fantasy Farming: Orange Season - довольно интересный симулятор фермера, из тех, что я когда-либо видел. Прежде чем начнутся крики в комментариях добавлю: "Мне показался он интересным, потому что разработан на RPG Maker". 

[h1][i]ИДЕЯ И СЮЖЕТ[/i][/h1]
Сама идея далеко не новая. Существует куча симуляторов фермера как на ПК так и на других платформах. Да что уж тут говорить, если даже на ВК сервисе их просто пруд пруди. Ну а что творится на других сервисах, думаю и упоминать не стоит. Идея избита до нельзя. В основном берется за идею построить идеальную ферму и по мере увеличения уровня вашего персонажа, открываются все новые фрукты или овощи. Мало кто ожидает от подобных играх, даже попытки сделать внятный сюжет с квестами. Но тут появляются Hudell Tales со своим Fantasy Farming и нарушают все эталоны данного жанра. За сюжет взята довольно простая история одного паренька, которого задолбала жизнь в городе. Он переезжает в маленькое уютное поселение Orange Town и покупает "маленький" участок под огород и разведение живности. После идет такое маленькое ознакомление с местными людьми, которые могут давать вам разнообразные квесты, к примеру: вырасти редиску, покорми одного из жителей, разгадай загадку в местных копальнях и многое другое. 

[h1][i]ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ[/i][/h1]
Геймплейная часть не то чтобы уж сильно разнообразная, тем не менее вспахивать, поливать и рассаживать семена на вашем огороде придется вам самим. И самое главное - это то, что у вашего персонажа стамины не так уж и много и пополнять ее можно лишь едой или сном. Самое привлекательное в этой игре, что можно находить и использовать инструменты типа: молот, топор, коса и прочее. На вашем огороде очень много мусора и кто как не вы способны убрать его полностью. Сам по себе карта в игре не такая уж и маленькая, и придется знатно так попотеть, чтобы изучить ее до конца. Справа от города существует также лабиринт, который пройти ой как не просто (мне это так и не удалось). Ну и куда же без магии? Именно в этом лабиринте мы встречаем ведьму, которая за маленькую помощь дает нам артефакт, способный телепортировать главного героя, как в город, так и на его родную ферму. Помимо изучение местности нам придется также заниматься и самим огородом: вспахивать, поливать, сажать и ухаживать за растениями. В придачу ко всему присутствует система скотоводства.

[h1][i]ГРАФИКА И ЗВУКИ[/i][/h1]
Что можно вытянуть из такого движка как RPG Maker? Да практически ничего. Графика пиксельная, местами, конечно, красивая, но очень угловатая и уж очень азиатская. Удалось ли разработчикам превзойти самих себя? Думаю больше нет, чем да. На самом деле графика довольно хороша, если учесть движок игры, но не более того. Цикл роста растений и их разнообразие впечатляет, но во всем остальном довольно стандартно. Обычные движения персонажей, реплики в виде диалоговых окон, азиатского вида персонажи - это все на что способен этот движок, к большому сожалению. У игры огромнейший потенциал в виде не просто симулятора фермера, а целой фермерской жизни, но этот потенциал может быть загублен в такой простой и однообразной графической обвертке. Музыкальное и звуковое сопровождение довольно спокойное и не вызывает особо много эмоций. В принципе так и должно быть в симуляторе, но это при условии, если графическая составляющая выполнена на хорошем уровне. Здесь же все немного наоборот - сама обвертка у игры довольно стандартна и даже отталкивающая. Самый смак состоит в геймплейной части и самом процессе создание прекрасного огорода и сада, с огромным количеством животных в хлеву!

[h1][i]ПЛЮСЫ И МИНУСЫ[/i][/h1]
Плюсы:
+ Наличие сюжета и квестов
+ Разнообразие в растениях, животных
+ Дух фермерства практически в каждой секунде игры
+ Наличие юмора и стеба над разработчиками
+ Приятное музыкальное сопровождение

Минусы:
- Магия портит атмосферу игры
- Однотипные персонажи (из-за движка RPG Maker)
- Довольно средняя графическая оболочка

Fantasy Farming: Orange Season - до сих пор находится в раннем доступе, и многое еще поменяется и добавится. На этом этапе можно поставить 8 из 10, за довольно перспективный симулятор фермера.

review:
Keep in mind that this game is still in Early Access and things can and will change. 

Ahh, another farming simulator hits Steam. As a huge fan of the Harvest Moon series, I definitely put aside some money to purchase this game. Please bear in mind that I only got up to Spring 27, Year 1 and basing my review on everything I've seen so far.

Unlike other farming simulation games, the main character was not left to tend to a farm of a deceased relative, but in fact had aspirations to become a farmer since they were young. The first day you are introduced to the mayor who helps get you settled into your new home along with another farmer who helps teach you the basics of farming. After a quick tutorial, you can take your character outside the farm and begin exploring.

Pros
+Controller support
+Nice looking graphics
+Several different crops to grow in each season.
+Characters are unique and have different personalities.
+Tasks available to complete.
+Several different animals you can raise.
+Being able to edit the contents of the shipping bin before it's shipped. Very helpful if you accidently put something in you needed.
+You recieve a dog on Spring 2, Year 1.
+One of the coolest features, which reminds me of Animal Crossing, is being able to write letters to other characters, including your mom!
+Lots of areas to explore and forage to collect.

Cons
-Not much to do in the first couple days. I found myself running around town several times just to kill time.
-No map to help keep track of exploration.
-Some of the building/store times of operation are weird. Why is the library only open for 7 hours in the middle of the day?
-Female playable character not implemented yet as of 4/22/17.
-Only two skin choices.
-Some NPCs have no unique text and/or stand in one spot all day, every day.
-No storage unit to put extra things you don't need/want to collect.

Suggestions
= Add a statistics panel to track various stats such as conversations had, products/produce shipped.
= Add a relationships page to track relationships with characters.
= Add collectible shells at the beach.
= Add an in-game calendar.
= Add text to the television.
= Add a map.
= Add images to the character's text box.
= Add voice over to the opening cutscreen. 
= Add being able to get a cat.

If any of these things are already in-game and I just haven't unlocked them yet, please let me know. Otherwise this game shows great promise and I look forward to any and all updates! Brian Hudell is working very hard to provide the best customer service experience he can and has already provided several updates using suggestions from players.

In addition we also started a wiki for the game if anyone feels like editing and helping out: http://orange-season.wikia.com/wiki/Special:WikiActivity
